intro: Parosela eriophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parosela, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
